required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study With the seleXys PC and the RM Pressfit Vitamys Cup
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial With the seleXys PC Cup and RM Pressfit Vitamys Cup in Combination With the Optimys Short Stem

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized controlled trial with the seleXys PC cup and RM Pressfit vitamys cup in combination with the optimys short stem. Wear rate and migration is assessed with roentgen stereophotogrammetric analysis (RSA) measurements.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: prospective, randomised single-center study with 2 treatment arms.

primary_outcome.description: The principal purpose of this study is to compare the modular seleXys PC Cup with a vitamys inlay to the monoblock RM Pressfit vitamys cup by means of wear rate. In addition, the migration of the two cups and the optimys stem, respectively, will be evaluated.

arm_group.description: seleXys PC cup combined with the optimys stem
RM Pressfit vitamys cup combined with the optimys stem

intervention.description: Total hip arthroplasty using the seleXys PC cup
Total hip arthroplasty using the RM cup

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with symptomatic arthritis who are candidates for a primary total hip arthroplasty with an uncemented femoral stem as determined jointly by the surgeon and the patient.
- Patients suitable for an uncemented acetabular component in combination with a 36mm femoral head (seleXys PC cup: 52mm, 54mm or 56mm; RM Pressfit vitamys: 52mm, 54mm or 56mm)
- Patients between the ages of 50 and 75 inclusive
- Patients who understand the conditions of the study and are willing to participate for the length of the prescribed follow-up
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients that require an acetabular cup size which cannot be used in combination with a 36mm femoral head
- Patients that offer no guarantee for regular follow-up controls
- Patients that have a revision surgery
- Patients that have a fracture of the femoral neck or a bone tumour in the area of the femur or pelvis
- Patients that had a previous osteotomy of the femur or pelvis
- Pregnant women or those seeking to become pregnant
- Patients with a history of active infection

overall_official.affiliation: Klinik für Orthopädie und Traumatologie, Universitätsspital Basel

facility.name: Klinik für Orthopädie und Traumatologie, University Hospital Basel
